page.title: 10Methodist Chapel in Cumbria
page.content: The 78 year old Methodist Chapel at Castle Sowerby is built of corrugated iron (photograph included). It consists of a main room panelled in wood with an alter and wooden pews, and an ante-room used for Sunday School. About 20 people attend the weekly Service, which is conducted by one of the 18 preachers on the Wigton Methodist Circuit. There is also a midweek Bible Class. About 16 children aged 3 - 13 attend the Sunday School regularly, mostly from non- Methodist families. They have Bible stories, singing and quizes. There are annual parties and outings. The Chapel is administered by a couple who combine the duties of Chairman, Secretary, Treasurer, Caretaker and Cleaner.
